results.title: Vincent Van Gogh
results.brief_description: Van Gogh’s life story, the development of his work and his struggle against madness and poverty told by excerpts from his letters to his beloved brother, Theo. The artist’s paintings and scenes taken at localities in which he lived and worked provide the visual material. Shows his early drawings, his move to Paris, his time in Arles and Saintes-Maries and his enthusiasm for the southern landscape, his time in hospitals at Arles and Saint-Remy, Gauguin’s visit, and Van Gogh’s final sojourn with a doctor in Auvers near Paris.

results.title: Victoria changing faces changing places
results.brief_description: This short documentary addresses the issues that surround Victoria’s growing population, whilst also probing the past and how migration helped shaped the current demographic. Using voice-over narration, this features an array of archival footage to examine the underlying drivers of population growth, with a view to understanding how the community is changing, and the what the future is likely to hold for Victoria.

results.title: Victoria : The First 150 Years
results.creator_credit: Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria
results.brief_description: An overview of Victoria covering its history, culture and landscape. Gold, sport, bushfires and rural Victoria are amongst the subjects covered and there is also a significant use of historical film footage in this description of Victoria.

results.title: Victoria's welcome to press delegates
results.brief_description: Viscount Burnham is welcomed by S.S. Argyle, M.L.A. Chief Secretary of Victoria. Items of interest are pointed out, indicating Victoria’s development as a state including footage of Sir John Monash, development of the Hume Weir, Yallourn Open Cut mine, the Dandenong Ranges/Ferntree Gully, Yarra Glen, Camperdown, Rochester, the “Better Farming Train”, Bendigo, Geelong and Geelong Grammar, and Ballarat. Source: National Film and Sound Archive.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 2
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Annemaree and Doug from Hawthorn telling us about the significance of her rings and his passion for AFL Footy; Emily, John and Raj talk about ‘favourite friends’; Kate from Elwood tells us about Elephant; Christy from Elwood loves her Edward B. Bear and Anthony shows us his favourite party trick

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 8
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Madelaine talking about her love of clothes; Emma from Fitzroy’s favourite thing is sleeping; Sarah, Melanie and Hayley from Cranbourne really dig Lord Of The Rings (and friendship); and Jack from Surrey Hills talks about his Yu Gi Oh Model Kit.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 3
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment has David from Birregurra talking about his new Motorbike; Paul, Louise, Ella and Matthew show us a Duck and Mr Pumpkin Head; Lucy from Perth shares a Poem; Alisha and Anna from Canterbury talk about Teddy Sascha and Alisha; Mary from Watsonia explains her passion for her horse; Mark and Liz talk about their kids; and Danielle from Melbourne discusses her favourite film ‘Chopper’.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 11
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Kenton from Nundawading who just loves life and the state of Victoria; a woman who has four deeply meaningful Rings; Nairee and Michelle from Traralgon tell us about ‘my dog Oscar’; and Adrian from Brunswick has a passion for Melbourne’s live music scene.
